origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Duke University. Office of Durham and Regional Affairs. Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership

did.abstract: The Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership(DDNP) collaborates with the twelve communities surrounding the Duke Campus on a wide range of neighborhood support and revitalization projects.The Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership Records contains planning documents, correspondence, meeting notes and other materials on the programs and initiatives sponsored by the Duke Durham Neighborhood Partnership between 2000 and 2012. It also includes materials pertaining to the administrative management of civic affairs and community outreach efforts at Duke University.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for official university records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership Records, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: Duke University Office of Durham and Regional Affairs Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership Transfer, February 2014

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by: Elizabeth J. Hannigan, August 2015

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership is a division of the Office of Durham & Regional Affairs dedicated to working with the twelve Durham neighborhoods surrounding the Duke Campus. The program was established in the mid-1990â€™s under the leadership of Duke President Nannerl Keohane after an extensive review of similar community relations projects undertaken at similar colleges and universities. The Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership works with residents within surrounding communities on projects including education, youth outreach, affordable housing and health care. DDNP also seeks to increase ties between Duke University students and Durham through programs such as the Duke-Durham Engage Program.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership Records contain detailed information on the programs and initiatives sponsored by the Duke Durham Neighborhood Partnership between 2000 and 2012. The collection contains planning documents, correspondence, notes and other materials related to both individual projects, as well as long-term programs such as the John Hope Franklin Youth Scholars program and collaborations with Durham Public Schools and Walltown Neighborhood Ministries. The collection also includes administrative materials employed by Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership committees and staff members including meeting minutes, background research, program evaluations and staff correspondence.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: For a period of twenty-five years from the origin of the material, permission in writing from the office of origin and the University Archivist is required for use of administrative records. After twenty-five years, records that have been processed may be consulted with the permission of the University Archivist.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the University Archives to use this collection.

controlaccess.subject: Community development, Urban -- North Carolina -- Durham
controlaccess.corpname: Duke University. Office of Durham and Regional Affairs. Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership
Duke University. Office of Durham and Regional Affairs. Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Programs and Initiatives series contains materials relating to the different projects implemented by the Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership (DDNP). Materials been organized into subseries around major areas of interest such as Durham Public Schools, the Facilities Management Department at Duke University, the John Hope Franklin Youth Scholars program and the Walltown community, as well as a General Projects subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Durham Public Schools subseries contains correspondence, planning materials, presentations and other notes pertaining to collaborations between the DDNP and Durham Public Schools, including projects at E.K. Powe Elementary School and Watts Montessori School.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Facilities Management Department subseries focuses on projects in which the Facilities Management Department contributed time and expertise to collaborate with the DDNP and local communities on a variety of projects.

did.unittitle: Duke Facilities Mgmt. and the NPI 1 of 2
Duke Facilities Mgmt. and the NPI 2 of 2

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The John Hope Franklin Scholars subseries encompasses materials relating to the John Hope Franklin Young Scholars program, a program focused on exploring topics in African-American history with young Durham students. This subseries contains materials related to participant recruitment, curriculum and field trip planning, as well as correspondence among the board of advisors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The General Projects subseries is comprised of correspondence, news articles, planning materials and other notes about Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership projects including the Duke School Days Program, the Duke-Durham Engage Program and the renovation of the old Duke Laundry into senior housing units.

did.unittitle: Leadership in a Changing World: Nominations
Healthcare Issues in SW Central Durham

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Walltown subseries contains materials related to projects undertaken in the neighboring community of Walltown, including many collaborations with Walltown Neighborhood Ministries. This subseries also includes information on DDNP projects to help build affordable housing units, support the Walltown Health Clinic and efforts to implement the Walltown Connectivity Project to improve internet access for residents of the neighborhood.

did.unittitle: Walltown Neighborhood Ministries: Letter to Self-Help in sublease, Healing of the Heart Ministry
Walltown Neighborhood Ministries: Letter to Self-Help in sublease, Healing of the Heart Ministry
WNM: Offer to Purhase Contract 1227 Berkeley St.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Administrative Materials series compiles materials related to the administrative management of the Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership. Materials have been organized in subseries by their administrative function such as Community/Civic Engagement, the DDNP Advisory Board and Evaluation materials, as well as a General Materials subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Community/Civic Engagement subseries includes notes and correspondence relating to the Center for Civic Engagement and Department of Community Affairs, including planning documents, notes from annual meetings and correspondence among board members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The DDNP Advisory Board subseries contains meeting minutes, correspondence, reports and other materials used during meetings of the Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership Advisory Board.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Evaluations subseries includes external and internal reviews of the impact of the Duke-Durham Neighborhood Partnership on surrounding communities and evaluations of individual projects such as the School Days program.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The General Materials subseries is comprised of correspondence, planning documents and other notes used by staff members of the Duke- Durham Neighborhood Partnership.

did.unittitle: Duke's Economic Impact and Community Assesment Planning: West End and SWCD
